publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: To the Tune of, Ye Commons and Peers.
AT a Sessions of Late,there arose a Debate,
Which the Dons of the Country resented;where 'tis said that the Juryin mistaken Fury
An Orthodox Church-man Presented.
By a P---r at their Head these Gentlemen lead,
Did boldly petition his Grace,that Business to quietwhich they thought a Riot,
And guard the Queen Majesty's Peace.
But the good Man in black no Courage did lack,
Gave no ground, nor did bate them an Ace,tho' they huf't and look'd big, Sir,they frighten'd not Hig, Sir,
But he bravely supported his place.
Of his Actions to boast,
they began with a Toast,
to William their Hero brave:
Ah Sir! I profess,'tis a pitiful Case
To disturb a Man's Rest in his Grave.
In peace let him lye, with his Memory,
While our Glorious Queen Anne fills the Throne;by Birth and by Meritlong may she inherit,
In spight of her Foes, what's her own.
But her Foes; who unite to Invade her just Right,
Wou'd be their own Monarchs Electors,to pull High-flyers downthose fast Friends of the Crown,
And set up themselves for Protectors.
Still her Enemies aim at their 41 Game,
Enrag'd, while they Cant Moderation;that Knaves may turn Trumpas the P-------t Rump,
Palm'd bad Votes for good Laws of the Nation.
Some with Addle-pates, in furious Debates,
Have rail'd at the Gown in great passion,'cause they have their hearts onFanatical W-----n,
Who wou'd fain bring the Cloak into Fashion.
Hence these Gentlemen boldly, on the Doctor fell fouly,for slighting an Health so profane,
They'd give him their Wordof their own accord,
In the Peace he'd no longer remain.
They told him in short, he attempted the part,
To be for the Tories a Bully,but Reverend Master,you'll find the Disaster,
We'll make you come off Sir but dully.
For they thought without doubt the Doctor must out,
When their Train they together did summon;tho' vainly apply'd,that every side,
Shou'd hope what they wish, is but common.
The Doctor ne'rless is come off with Success,
As his principles honest, assisted;tho' the World does disclose,that his Friends at the Rose,
A Sentence so just have resisted.
For as we do hear, they cited to Swear,
Some persons in Office and Trust;I shall instance but One,that is as good as Ten,
The Maker of the Queen's Pye-crust.
This Witness they say, lives at Drogheda,
An Evidence chief in the Case,But she wou'd not be seen,for fear least the Queen,
Shou'd turn her out of her place.
Thus by giving them rope they have answer'd our scope,
And their Line is now brought to an End.The Doctor's just Cause,For our Queen and Her Laws,
The Church's True Friends will defend.
But as it is common, when Death Men does summon,
For Life to make Efforts in vain,So their impotent Malicehas made some faint Sallies
But now dead, may they ne'er rise again.
